title: player behaviour and tribunal
body:
i am wondering how effective reporting is these days?
i report one person every game but ive only ever got 1 message telling me the person i reported gets banned.
i noticed when it doesn't effect the other players they rarely rarely will report the person that is ruining the game. (e.g feeder mid demands blue and then purposely lets jungler die by standing still in a fight)
i understand the internet is a place without rules and you need to be thick skinned or have some sort of expectation on the people you will come across BUT for a game that has a report system and 'tribunal' and people complaining about toxic players/trolls everyday, league of legends oce is an absolute shit hole.
i use to play dota which is a similar MOBA and reports and bans are much more serious. just for not accepting q you can get banned up to 24 hours which i use to think was excessive but after playing LoL for a while ive come to realize that if people don't want to play properly to rank up or play with each other then they shouldn't get to play the game with other people and should stick with bots.
i propose people should come together and protest against how shitty riot is handling this situation.
instead of focusing on skins and hextech boxes which just make them more money they should make the gaming experience more enjoyable for the players, somethinng that should be the most important thing about games.

sorry if its poorly worded but this issue should not be ignored

replies.body:
Hey man,

I'm sorry you've had some unsportsmanlike experiences recently. We definitely want to help build a culture of sportsmanship within our game and will continue to work hard at it. 

You can read more about our efforts here

http://boards.oce.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/player-behaviour/Y9YJ60Fn-player-behaviour-faq

where is the evidence to back that up?

i hope riot will come across my other post regarding the statistics so they can show everyone a graph or whatever on the amount of reports made and amount of reports dealt with.

this isn't just for me but i think it will help us all as a community

I don't think the "Report Feedback" notification pops up unless the punishment was directly related to your report. Just because you don't see the pop up after every report, even if the behaviour experienced was quite extreme, that doesn't necessarily mean nothing was registered in the system or that nothing will happen to that player in the future.

i suspect they don't do anything because there aren't that many players in the first place compared to servers like NA and China servers but that is no excuse to ruin the experience of other players that aren't scum.
PLS PPL LETS NOT LET THEM GIVE US CANCER

the only way we can stop this madness is to stop giving riot any of our money.
stop getting hooked into fancy skins people. 

if you really enjoy this game like i do then stop giving riot our precious money until they clean this cesspool of a server/game.

"Does Riot read every report?

Every report is analysed by our system. Reports and corresponding game chat logs are reviewed by our Player Support team when we are considering severe punishments such as permanent bans. We also regularly use comments from reports and logs to ensure the accuracy of our systems."


But how many people are working on this?
I've seen that post a long time ago
ive been a player for years and nothing has changed and if anything it has gotten worse.

If my experience is similar to other people, where i have to report one person every game then you need a team of people just to sort out all the reports from the whole OCE server

One response every 2 years from riot telling me 1 person i reported has been banned is extremely poor effort.

I appreciate you responding to my post but it only shows me that riot has a few mods on the forum and a default response to everything (e.g read this sticky)
STOP BUYING SKINS PEOPLE. STOP GIVING RIOT MONEY UNTIL THEY DO SOMETHING ABOUT MAKING THE GAMING EXPERIENCE BETTER AND IM NOT TALKING ABOUT GRAPHICS OR HOW THE UI LOOKS IN CHAMP SELECT
